title: Regex Patterns in NotebookAutomation.Core Assembly
details:
Complete catalog of all regex patterns found in the NotebookAutomation.Core assembly:

## CourseStructureExtractor.cs
1. `@"^(\d+)[_-]"` - NumberPrefixRegex (MyRegex) - Matches leading numbers followed by separator
2. `@"^\d+[_-]?"` - MyRegex1 - Matches leading numbers with optional separator  
3. `@"\s+"` - MyRegex2 - Matches whitespace (appears multiple times in different files)
4. `@"(?i)module\s*[_-]?\s*(\d+)[_-]?\s*(.+?)(?:\.\w+)?$"` - ModuleFilenameRegex
5. `@"(?i)lesson\s*[_-]?\s*(\d+)[_-]?\s*(.+?)(?:\.\w+)?$"` - LessonFilenameRegex  
6. `@"(?i)(week|unit|session|class)\s*[_-]?\s*(\d+)[_-]?\s*(.+?)(?:\.\w+)?$"` - WeekUnitFilenameRegex
7. `@"(?i)module(\d+)([a-zA-Z]+.*)"` - CompactModuleRegex
8. `@"(?i)lesson(\d+)([a-zA-Z]+.*)"` - CompactLessonRegex
9. `@"(?i)module(\d+)"` - ModuleNumberSeparatorRegex
10. `@"(?i)lesson(\d+)"` - LessonNumberSeparatorRegex
11. `@"^(\d+)[_-](.+)"` - NumberedContentRegex
12. `@"(week|unit)[_\s-]*\d+"` - WeekUnitRegex
13. `@"(module|lesson)[_\s-]*\d+"` - ModuleLessonNumberRegex
14. `@"(session|class)[_\s-]*\d+"` - SessionClassNumberRegex
15. `@"(?<=[a-z])(?=[A-Z])"` - CamelCaseRegex

## FriendlyTitleHelper.cs
16. `@"^[0-9]+([_\-\s]+)"` - LeadingNumberPattern
17. `"[_\\-]+"` - SeparatorPattern
18. `"\\s+"` - WhitespacePattern (duplicate pattern)
19. `@"\bIi\b"` - RomanNumeralIIPattern
20. Inline patterns: `@"\blesson\b"`, `@"\blessons\b"`, etc. (dynamic pattern building)
21. `@"\b([A-Za-z]+) Ii\b"` - Inline Roman numeral fix pattern
22. Dynamic acronym patterns: `"\\b{acronym}\\b"`

## YamlHelper.cs  
23. `@"^\s*---\s*[\r\n]+(.+?)[\r\n]+\s*---\s*[\r\n]+"` - FrontmatterBlockRegex

## MetadataTemplateManager.cs
24. `@"^---\s*$"` - YamlDocumentSeparatorRegex

## DocumentNoteBatchProcessor.cs
25. `@"^##\s+Notes\s*$"` - NotesHeaderRegex

## MarkdownParser.cs
26. `@"^---\s*\n(.*?)\n---\s*\n"` - YamlFrontmatterRegex
27. `@"^(#+)\s+(.+)$"` - MarkdownHeaderRegex

## MarkdownNoteProcessor.cs
28. `"<.*?>"` - HtmlTagStripperRegex (new Regex, not GeneratedRegex)

## RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter.cs
29. `@"^\s*(#{1,6})\s+.+$"` - MarkdownHeaderRegex (different from MarkdownParser)
30. `@"```[\s\S]*?```"` - CodeBlockRegex
31. `@"^\s*[-*+]\s+.+$"` - BulletedListRegex
32. `@"^\s*\d+\.\s+.+$"` - NumberedListRegex

## PromptTemplateService.cs
33. `"{{(.*?)}}"` - TemplateVariableRegex

Usage patterns found:
- IsMatch() calls
- Match() calls  
- Replace() calls
- Split() calls
